Topic.Title: Keep climate change out of Keystone decision, GOP warns in letter to Obama

Message.Msg: Transporting the oil by less efficient route does waste resources. Solution: approve the pipeline; place a tariff on the oil moving along; use the tariff revenues to fund feed in tariffs for solar & wind. The solar & wind will displace demand for coal & natural gas and reduce C02 emissions.

Don't forget to include multiple time steps in your analysis. One time step models of rational choice rarely optimize outcomes across time when compared to a multi-step game theory approach. They are simple to understand but incomplete and inferior. Through methods of backward induction one can pick the best path along a multi-step approach. Things like the differential rate of technological gain from this or that investment policy, learning by doing, and other factors relevant to the future payoffs can be captured. Maximizing the payoff for Exxon Mobil in one step is not ideal.

I cannot grasp the meaning of your statement. I think we need to use as much solar and wind as possible even if the cost is higher than natural gas,etc. America seems driven by large corporations trying to maximize profits. and usually thinking short term at best. For instance, it should be made mandatory by law, that all new housing and buildings built in the southwest US to be solar. In areas where there is adequate wind, wind power must be mandated. America needs to ween itself from petroleum as much as possible.
It will be a long, long time before renewable energy develop to the point where it starts effecting the income of XOM.

Topic.Title: Keep climate change out of Keystone decision, GOP warns in letter to Obama

Message.Msg: you make an excellent point hansesteelyard. However, I see no reason to help the Asian countries to achieve energy. ALL that oil from Canada is contracted to the Asian markets. I have read most of the Keystone proposal. That oil will flow and be delivered to southern Texas refineries to either be refined or passed thru as raw crude to be put on tankers to pass thru the Panama Canal Zone west bound to Asia. One reason why the Canal is being widened for super tankers to to facilitate crude traveling to the Fareast. I say do not aide and abet the Communist Chinese !
It will be a long, long time before renewable energy develop to the point where it starts effecting the income of XOM----wrong...

Topic.Title: Keep climate change out of Keystone decision, GOP warns in letter to Obama

Message.Msg: Yes I know. They will just use railroads if they are denied pipelines and that would cause even more pollution. If you make their pipeline into a funding source for renewables they end up funding the destruction of their own markets.
